alert.note: Alert for Logan (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 5:43AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Mingo, southern Logan and northwestern Wyoming Counties through 615 AM EST... At 542 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mcandrews, or 10 miles south of Williamson, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Oceana, Man, Hanover, R.d. Bailey Lake, Gilbert Creek, Mallory, Amherstdale-Robinette, Red Jacket, Hinch, Buskirk, Matewan, Gilbert, Chauncey, Coal Mountain, Bruno, Sarah Ann, Meador, Clear Fork, Cyclone and Hampden. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Flash Flood Watch remains in effect. Heavy downpours could cause rapid rises in water. If rising water is observed, move to higher ground. Do not drive into areas covered by water.
